00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_wif_trace.h - Implementation of WIF tracing.
00023 
00024   Original Author - Abhijit Ghosh, Synopsys, Inc.
00025 
00026  *****************************************************************************/
00027 
00028 /*****************************************************************************
00029 
00030   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00031   changes you are making here.
00032 
00033       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00034   Description of Modification:
00035 
00036  *****************************************************************************/
00037 
00038 /*****************************************************************************
00039 
00040    Acknowledgement: The tracing mechanism is based on the tracing
00041    mechanism developed at Infineon (formerly Siemens HL). Though this
00042    code is somewhat different, and significantly enhanced, the basics
00043    are identical to what was originally contributed by Infineon.
00044    The contribution of Infineon in the development of this tracing
00045    technology is hereby acknowledged.
00046 
00047  *****************************************************************************/
00048 
00049 /*****************************************************************************
00050 
00051    Instead of creating the binary WIF format, we create the ASCII
00052    WIF format which can be converted to the binary format using
00053    a2wif (utility that comes with VSS from Synopsys). This way,
00054    a user who does not have Synopsys VSS can still create WIF
00055    files, but the files can only be viewed by users who have VSS.
00056 
00057  *****************************************************************************/
00058 
00059 #ifndef SC_WIF_TRACE_H
00060 #define SC_WIF_TRACE_H
00061 
00062 #include <cstdio>
00063 #include "sysc/datatypes/int/sc_nbdefs.h"
00064 #include "sysc/tracing/sc_trace_file_base.h"
00065 
00066 namespace sc_core {
00067 
00068 class wif_trace;  // defined in wif_trace.cc
00069 template<class T> class wif_T_trace;
00070 
00071 class wif_trace_file
00072   : public sc_trace_file_base
00073 {
00074 public:
00075     enum wif_enum {WIF_BIT=0, WIF_MVL=1, WIF_REAL=2, WIF_LAST};
00076 
00077     // Create a wif trace file.
00078     // `Name' forms the base of the name to which `.awif' is added.
00079     explicit wif_trace_file(const char *name);
00080 
00081     ~wif_trace_file();
00082 
00083 protected:
00084     // These are all virtual functions in sc_trace_file and
00085     // they need to be defined here.
00086 
00087     // Trace sc_time, sc_event
00088     virtual void trace(const sc_time& object, const std::string& name);
00089     virtual void trace(const sc_event& object, const std::string& name);
00090 
00091     // Trace a boolean object (single bit)
00092      void trace(const bool& object, const std::string& name);
00093 
00094     // Trace a sc_bit object (single bit)
00095      void trace(const sc_dt::sc_bit& object, const std::string& name);
00096 
00097     // Trace a sc_logic object (single bit)
00098      void trace(const sc_dt::sc_logic& object, const std::string& name);
00099 
00100     // Trace an unsigned char with the given width
00101      void trace(const unsigned char& object, const std::string& name,
00102         int width);
00103 
00104     // Trace an unsigned short with the given width
00105      void trace(const unsigned short& object, const std::string& name,
00106          int width);
00107 
00108     // Trace an unsigned int with the given width
00109      void trace(const unsigned int& object, const std::string& name,
00110          int width);
00111 
00112     // Trace an unsigned long with the given width
00113      void trace(const unsigned long& object, const std::string& name,
00114          int width);
00115 
00116     // Trace a signed char with the given width
00117      void trace(const char& object, const std::string& name, int width);
00118 
00119     // Trace a signed short with the given width
00120      void trace(const short& object, const std::string& name, int width);
00121 
00122     // Trace a signed int with the given width
00123      void trace(const int& object, const std::string& name, int width);
00124 
00125     // Trace a signed long with the given width
00126      void trace(const long& object, const std::string& name, int width);
00127 
00128     // Trace a signed long long with the given width
00129      void trace(const sc_dt::int64& object, const std::string& name,
00130          int width);
00131 
00132     // Trace an usigned long long with the given width
00133      void trace(const sc_dt::uint64& object, const std::string& name,
00134          int width);
00135 
00136     // Trace a float
00137      void trace(const float& object, const std::string& name);
00138 
00139     // Trace a double
00140      void trace(const double& object, const std::string& name);
00141 
00142     // Trace sc_unsigned
00143      void trace (const sc_dt::sc_unsigned& object,
00144          const std::string& name);
00145 
00146     // Trace sc_signed
00147      void trace (const sc_dt::sc_signed& object,
00148          const std::string& name);
00149 
00150     // Trace sc_uint_base
00151      void trace (const sc_dt::sc_uint_base& object,
00152          const std::string& name);
00153 
00154     // Trace sc_int_base
00155      void trace (const sc_dt::sc_int_base& object, const std::string& name);
00156 
00157     // Trace sc_fxval
00158     void trace( const sc_dt::sc_fxval& object, const std::string& name );
00159 
00160     // Trace sc_fxval_fast
00161     void trace( const sc_dt::sc_fxval_fast& object,
00162         const std::string& name );
00163 
00164     // Trace sc_fxnum
00165     void trace( const sc_dt::sc_fxnum& object, const std::string& name );
00166 
00167     // Trace sc_fxnum_fast
00168     void trace( const sc_dt::sc_fxnum_fast& object,
00169         const std::string& name );
00170 
00171     template<class T>
00172     void traceT(const T& object, const std::string& name, wif_enum type)
00173     {
00174         if( add_trace_check(name) )
00175             traces.push_back( new wif_T_trace<T>( object, name
00176                                                 , obtain_name(),type ) );
00177     }
00178 
00179     // Trace sc_bv_base (sc_bv)
00180     virtual void trace( const sc_dt::sc_bv_base& object,
00181         const std::string& name );
00182 
00183     // Trace sc_lv_base (sc_lv)
00184     virtual void trace( const sc_dt::sc_lv_base& object,
00185         const std::string& name );
00186 
00187     // Trace an enumerated object - where possible output the enumeration literals
00188     // in the trace file. Enum literals is a null terminated array of null
00189     // terminated char* literal strings.
00190      void trace(const unsigned& object, const std::string& name,
00191          const char** enum_literals);
00192 
00193     // Output a comment to the trace file
00194      void write_comment(const std::string& comment);
00195 
00196     // Write trace info for cycle.
00197      void cycle(bool delta_cycle);
00198 
00199 private:
00200 
00201 #if SC_TRACING_PHASE_CALLBACKS_
00202     // avoid hidden overload warnings
00203     virtual void trace( sc_trace_file* ) const;
00204 #endif // SC_TRACING_PHASE_CALLBACKS_
00205 
00206     // Initialize the tracing mechanism
00207     virtual void do_initialize();
00208 
00209     unsigned wif_name_index;           // Number of variables traced
00210 
00211     unit_type previous_units_low;
00212     unit_type previous_units_high;
00213 
00214 public:
00215     // Create wif names for each variable
00216     std::string obtain_name();
00217 
00218     // Array to store the variables traced
00219     std::vector<wif_trace*> traces;
00220 };
00221 
00222 } //  namespace sc_core
00223 
00224 #endif // SC_WIF_TRACE_H
